str2: Sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable. From hamartano; sinful, i.e. A sinner.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and keimai; to lie down, i.e. be sick; specially, to recline at a meal.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: From a primary komeo; properly, to provide for, i.e. to carry off.
Neuter of alabastros, the name of a stone; properly, an 'alabaster' box, i.e. a perfume vase.
Anointing-oil, ointment. Probably of foreign origin; 'myrrh', i.e. perfumed oil.
